title._content: [Villa I Tatti, Ponte a Mensola, near Settignano, Italy. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [Villa I Tatti, Ponte a Mensola, near Settignano, Italy. View from villa] [1925 summer] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Cecil Ross Pinset, from 1909. Landscape: Cecil Ross Pinset, from 1909, and with Geoffrey Scott from 1914. Associated Name: Bernard and Mary Smith (Mrs. Bernard) Berenson. Today: House and restored gardens now Harvard University Center for Renaissance Studies. On slide (printed): "Edward Van Altena" and "71-79 W. 45th St., N.Y.C." (slide manufacturer). Slide for lecturing on "Old World Gardens." Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 200. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16497 Call Number: LC-J717-X104- 41
